title: 2025 Emmys predictions: Who will win, who will get snubbed
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 2025 Emmys are predicted to see wins for shows like 'Severance,' 'Adolescence,' and 'The Studio.'
'Andor' is considered a more deserving winner than 'Severance' for Best Drama, but is expected to be snubbed.
Kathy Bates, predicted to win Best Actress (Drama) for 'Matlock,' faces a strong contender in Britt Lower from 'Severance.'

title: Alex Bregman shares his advice for younger Red Sox teammates down the stretch
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Alex Bregman advises young Red Sox teammates to focus on execution as playoff race intensifies.
Red Sox hold AL's second wildcard spot with an 81-68 record but face challenges as they finish season.
Bregman hits first home run since August in Saturday's 5-3 loss, focuses on improving team performance.

title: 3 takeaways from the Revolution’s 1-1 draw vs. Toronto FC
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: New England Revolution drew 1-1 with Toronto FC, thanks to Luca Langoni's 90th-minute equalizer at Gillette Stadium.
The Revolution's playoff hopes remain technically alive but are unlikely after struggling to close winnable matches.
18-year-old Allan Oyirwoth made his first MLS start, showing potential with calm possession and quality passes.

title: ‘We should stop talking October’: Alex Cora doesn’t want Red Sox to start thinking about playoffs yet
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Alex Cora advises the Red Sox to focus on present games, not future playoff scenarios.
Red Sox hold the second American League wild card spot, trailing Yankees by 1.5 games.
Boston has a 90% chance of making playoffs; tougher schedule could impact their position.

title: Red Sox CBO Craig Breslow reportedly prioritizing finding a GM this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Craig Breslow prioritizes hiring a general manager for the Red Sox this offseason as a second-in-command.
The Red Sox general manager role has been vacant since Breslow's appointment as chief baseball officer in 2024.
Assistant GMs Raquel Ferreira, Eddie Romero, Michael Groopman, Taylor Smith, and Paul Toboni are potential candidates.

title: Patriots move on from Ja’Lynn Polk, reportedly trading him to Saints
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots trade wide receiver Ja'Lynn Polk to Saints for a 2027 sixth-round pick, giving up a 2028 seventh-round pick.
Polk, a 2024 second-round draft pick, struggled with performance, contributing 12 receptions for 87 yards and two touchdowns.
Polk's 2025 season ended early due to a shoulder injury; he remains under contract, but Patriots have six other receivers.

title: 5 things to know about Dolphins before Patriots take them on in Week 2
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots face a five-game losing streak in Miami ahead of their Week 2 game against the Dolphins.
Dolphins suffer turmoil following a 33-8 blowout loss to the Colts, leading to a players-only meeting.
Tua Tagovailoa remains undefeated against the Patriots with a record of seven wins in seven starts.

title: Review & setlist: Ethel Cain haunts Roadrunner with Southern Gothic epic
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Ethel Cain performed a Southern Gothic themed concert at Roadrunner in Boston on September 12, 2025.
Cain's setlist included songs from her albums 'Willoughby Tucker, I'll Always Love You' and 'Preacher's Daughter'.
The concert featured atmospheric stage design and a guest appearance by Jae Matthews from Boy Harsher.

title: 45 years later, Andover High’s Chiklis returns to gridiron for ‘The Senior’
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Michael Chiklis stars as Mike Flynt in 'The Senior,' depicting Flynt's return to college football at age 59.
Chiklis, 62, a Lowell native and Andover High alum, hadn't played tackle football since 1980 prior to filming.
The film, directed by Rod Lurie, will have a pre-release screening in Boston before its national release on September 19.

title: Here are the Mass. residents who made the new Forbes list of 400 richest Americans
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Nine Massachusetts residents are listed among the Forbes 400 richest Americans, ranging from ranks 27 to 382.
Abigail Johnson is the wealthiest Mass. resident with a $35 billion net worth, ranking 27th in the U.S.
Robert Kraft, owner of the New England Patriots, ranks 78th nationwide with a net worth of $13.8 billion.
